questions.question_text: Which two public cloud accounts are supported for vRealize Automation? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C
With the vRealize Orchestrator integration to Cloud Assembly, you deploy a cloud extensibility proxy instance, that can be used for extensibility subscriptions and XaaS (Anything as a Service) operations used for cloud templates. 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Assembly/services/Using-and-Managing/GUID-6EF5FAA7-4480-4A1C-A0E5-5388369863A8.html

questions.question_text: Which vRealize Automation service is a development- and process-automation platform that supports extensibility and Anything-as-a-Service (XaaS) features in vRealize Automation?

While deploying a virtual machine blueprint, an administrator encounters the following error:
Error: com.vmware.xenon.common.LocalizableValidationException: Unable to find a valid subnet for network 'Network_External' of type 'EXISTING' with constraints '[dc:metro, tier:1]', reasons: [Network profile 'publicnet / Metro' was skipped because [Network [Network_External] allocation: cannot allocate a network with static IP ranges for profile 'publicnet / Metro'.]]
Where should the administrator start to troubleshoot?

discussion.content:
I agree with C:
I would start investigating on the settings in the network profiles, but the tagging could be wrong either.

C&D is correct tested in LAB
VRA - Cloud Assembly - Infrastructure - Integrations - vRealize Operations Manager
Are required for integration with vRealize Operations Manager the following mandatory details:
- Name
- IP Address / FQDN
- Username
- Password

I am wondering why answer C and D is about connection information of vROp. It should be the other way around since you have to add the vRA connections informations in vROp. This is exactly what is stated in the reference.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is tasked with integrating vRealize Operations and vRealize Automation.
Which two pieces of information will the administrator require to perform this integration? (Choose two.)

choices.C: The IP/FQDN of the vRealize Operations server
choices.E: The SSL certificate of the vRealize Operations server
choices.B: The vRealize Orchestrator details through which vRealize Operations will be configured
choices.A: The license key for vRealize Operations
choices.D: The vRealize Operations login username and password

questions.question_text: Which kubectl command should be run to find the Kubernetes authentication method?

discussion.content: B is correct. A show you information about a specific pod.
